text: Odessadale is an unincorporated community in Meriwether County, in the U.S. state of Georgia. ==History== Variant names were "Odessa" and "Xerxes". A post office called Odessadale was established in 1891, and remained in operation until 1953. The present name is after Odessa Jane Thompson, the daughter of a pioneer citizen. The Georgia General Assembly incorporated the town as Odessadale in 1905. The town's municipal charter was repealed in 1995. ==References== Category:Former municipalities in Georgia (U.S. state) Category:Unincorporated communities in Meriwether County, Georgia Category:Populated places disestablished in 1995 Category:Unincorporated communities in Georgia (U.S. state)
title: Odessadale, Georgia
